channel.title: Erivelton's GSoC 2018 - GSoC
channel.description: PhD Student at Cleveland State University

item.title: Geeting closer to the First Evaluation - week 3
item.description:
First Evaluation period is around in the corner. As was proposed on my first post of my timeline, the work I have been doing is on time.

For this past week, I added some functionalities to the Root Locus Editor. This time, the user can add: real poles, complex poles …
item.dc:creator: Erivelton Gualter

item.title: Plots are Working - week 2
item.description: Here we go one more week of code. This week I have continued my work from previous week related to interface of sisotool. Just reiterating what was done last week, I created a couple GUI to understand a little better how the UI Elements works in Octave. For this week …
item.dc:creator: Erivelton Gualter

item.title: Code begins - week 1
item.description:
The first week of coding has been completed.

As I mentioned in the last post, the goal of this previous week was to create a fixed layout to study the plot diagrams for the sisotool, as well as to add some UI Element functionality to control the interface. The following …
item.dc:creator: Erivelton Gualter

item.title: Community Bonding Period
item.description:
The community bonding period is over. The past 3 weeks were really busy because I was in my finals week, final projects and my doctoral research. However, I basically completed everything I wanted to before the “Coding officially begins!”:

  • Finished Optimal Control and Intelligent Control System classes;
  • Submitted a conference …
item.dc:creator: Erivelton Gualter

item.title: Welcome to Octave and Google Summer of Code
item.description: This summer I got accepeted to the Summer Google of Code under the GNU Octave. This program, admistred by Google, facilates the emergence of students to the Open Source Community. My primary goal to participate in the GSoC is to build a long term relationship with the open source community …
item.dc:creator: Erivelton Gualter
